etymology.description: 雪 (snow) + 梨 (pear) = a variety of pear; a transliteration of Sydney
etymology.interpretation: 雪梨 often refers to a type of juicy pear known for its light color resembling snow. It is also the transliteration for the city of Sydney in Chinese.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃雪梨(我喜歡吃雪梨)。
她明年要去雪梨大学(她明年要去雪梨大學)。
examples.pinyin: Tā míngnián yào qù Xuělí Dàxué.
examples.english: She will go to the University of Sydney next year.

examples.chinese: 雪梨是澳大利亚(雪梨是澳大利亞)的一个城市。
examples.pinyin: Xuělí shì Àodàlìyǎ de yí gè chéngshì.
examples.english: Sydney is a city in Australia.
